<p><object data="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf" height="378" id="clip_embed_player_flash" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="420"><param name="movie" value="http://www.twitch.tv/widgets/archive_embed_player.swf"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><param name="allowNetworking" value="all"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="flashvars" value="title=Docking%2Bthe%2BSpace%2BHoover&channel=dasvaldez&auto_play=false&start_volume=25&chapter_id=5096854"></object></p>

<p>While this may not be going in ludicrous speed, <a href="http://bit.ly/X3pgb6"><strong>DasValdez</strong></a> documented the making and orbiting of the Spaceballs Megamaid on his KSP twitch stream. The highlighted clip features his attempt to dock the vacuum cleaner to the maid. Will it suck? Will it blow up? Watch and see!</p>

Edited September 12, 2014 by Rowsdower

Dear me. What are these things coming out of her nose?

Sorry could not resist. That said I am quite impressed with impractical building projects such as these. May have to try a few myself once I get a better hang of launching miscellaneous junk into orbit properly.
